title: RIL, Mazagon Dock among 30 stocks with record dates for dividend, bonus, rights, split this week. Do you own any?
description: Reliance Industries, Tech Mahindra, and Mazagon Dock, among others, are in focus due to upcoming record dates for dividends, bonus issues, and stock splits. Shareholders need to hold shares on the record date to be eligible. Buying the stock one day before the ex-date ensures eligibility for dividends, while buying on the ex-date excludes such benefits.

html:
Reliance Industries, Tech Mahindra and Mazagon Dock among a host of other companies are likely to remain in focus this week as they are approaching their record dates for the purpose of dividend, bonus issues and stock split.

Tired of too many ads? Remove Ads

The record date is the date set by the company to decide the shareholders who are eligible to receive the offer. To be eligible for a buyback offer, bonus issue or a stock split, the shares should be in the demat account on the record date.

Shareholders who buy the stock at least one day before the ex-date are eligible for dividends as settlement happens the next day. Those buying the stock on the ex-date are not eligible for dividends/splits/bonus issues etc.

Here is a list of stocks that have their ex-dates for various purposes this week:

Monday, October 28

Tired of too many ads? Remove Ads

Dividend

Elecon Engineering Company announced a dividend of Rs 0.5 per share.

ICICI Lombard General Insurance Company announced an interim dividend of Rs 5.5 per share.

KSolves India announced an interim dividend of Rs 8 per share.

Bonus issue

Reliance Industries (RIL) has fixed October 28 as the record date for the purpose of their 1:1 bonus issue.

Rights issue

Shangar Decor had announced October 28 as the record date for the purpose of their rights issue of 7 shares for every share held by the shareholders at a price of Rs 5.76.


Stock split

Dr, Reddy’s Laboratories announced a stock split from a face value of Rs 5 per share to Re 1 per share.

Tired of too many ads? Remove Ads

Tuesday, October 29

Dividend

Infosys declared an interim dividend of Rs 21 per share.

Route Mobile had announced an interim dividend of Rs 6 per share.

Stock split

Quasar India announced a split of its shares from a face value of Rs 10 per share to Re 1 per share.

Wednesday, October 30

Dividend

CRISIL announced an interim dividend of Rs 15 per share

Gabriel India had announced an interim dividend of Rs 1.75 per share.

Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders announced an interim dividend of Rs 23.19 per share

Supreme Industries declared an interim dividend of Rs 10 per share

Stock split

Jash Engineering will be splitting its stock from a face value of Rs 10 per share to Rs 2 per share

Kck Industries will be splitting its shares from a face value of Rs 10 per share to Rs 2 per share

Master Trust will be splitting its shares from a face value of Rs 5 per share to Re 1 per share

Thursday, October 31

Dividend

Balkrishna Industries declared an interim dividend of Rs 4 per share

Bhansali Engineering Polymers announced an interim dividend of Re 1 per share

Birlasoft declared an interim dividend of Rs 2.5 per share

Ceenik Exports (India) had declared a dividend of Rs 15 per share

Dodla Dairy announced an interim dividend of Rs 3 per share

Godrej Consumer Products announced an interim dividend of Rs 5 per share

Julien Agro Infratech announced an interim dividend of Rs 0.05 per share

NTPC declared an interim dividend of Rs 2.5 per share

Ramkrishna Forgings will be paying an interim dividend of Re 1 per share

R R Kabel announced an interim dividend of Rs 2.5 per share

Supreme Petrochem announced an interim dividend of Rs 2.5 per share

Tech Mahindra announced an interim dividend of Rs 15 per share

Transport Corporation Of India announced an interim dividend of Rs 3.5 per share

Bonus issue

Sellwin Traders announced a bonus share issue in the ratio of 1:8

Stock split

Sellwin Traders will be splitting their shares a face value of Rs 10 per share to Rs 2 per share

(Disclaimer: Recommendations, suggestions, views and opinions given by the experts are their own. These do not represent the views of Economic Times)
